title: First Article Inspection (FAI) Complete Guide: AS9102 Compliance for Aerospace Manufacturing
excerpt: Comprehensive guide to First Article Inspection (FAI) requirements, AS9102 compliance, documentation procedures, and quality control processes for aerospace and defense manufacturing applications.

author.name: IIS Quality Assurance Team
author.title: AS9100 Certified Quality Engineers
author.bio: IIS quality experts with extensive experience in aerospace manufacturing, AS9100 implementation, and regulatory compliance for government and commercial aviation programs.

prerequisites: Understanding of AS9100 quality management system
Knowledge of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T)
learningObjectives: Understand FAI requirements and triggers per AS9102
Master AS9102 Form completion and documentation
Implement compliant measurement and inspection procedures
Establish effective FAI workflow and approval processes
Navigate customer-specific FAI requirements and variations

children.text: First Article Inspection (FAI) is a mandatory quality process in aerospace manufacturing that verifies the initial production run meets all specified requirements before full-scale production begins. This critical quality gate prevents costly downstream issues and ensures regulatory compliance throughout the product lifecycle.

content.title: Regulatory Requirement
content.content: FAI is mandatory for aerospace suppliers per AS9102 standard. Non-compliance can result in supply chain suspension, contract termination, and significant financial penalties.

children.text: Per AS9102 Rev C, FAI must be performed for:
Initial production runs of new parts or assemblies
Engineering changes affecting form, fit, or function
Tooling changes that could affect part characteristics

content.title: FAI Timeline Requirements
content.description: Critical milestones and timelines for compliant FAI execution

children.text: AS9102 defines three forms that comprise the complete FAI documentation package. Each form serves a specific purpose in demonstrating compliance and traceability.

content.title: AS9102 Form Breakdown
content.description: Understanding the purpose and content of each AS9102 form

content.title: Form Completion Workflow
content.description: Systematic approach to completing AS9102 documentation

steps.title: Form 1 Preparation
steps.description: Complete part identification and accountability information
steps.qualityCheck: Verify all drawing revisions and change incorporations

steps.title: Form 2 Development
steps.description: Extract and list all measurable characteristics from drawings

steps.title: Measurement Planning
steps.description: Define measurement methods and acceptance criteria
steps.qualityCheck: Measurement capability adequate for tolerance verification

steps.title: Form 3 Execution
steps.description: Perform measurements and record actual results

content.title: Form 2 Best Practice
content.content: Use automated tools to extract characteristics from CAD models when possible. This reduces human error and ensures no characteristics are missed during the extraction process.

children.text: Accurate measurement is the foundation of successful FAI. Establish robust procedures that ensure repeatability, traceability, and compliance with customer requirements.

content.applications: All dimensional measurements for AS9102 compliance require calibrated equipment with documented traceability to national standards.
content.advantages: Ensures measurement reliability and regulatory compliance while providing defensible documentation for customer audits.

content.title: FAI Implementation Challenges
content.description: Common obstacles and proven solutions for successful FAI execution

content.title: Production Planning Impact
content.content: FAI approval is required before full production begins. Plan for 2-3 week lead times including inspection, documentation, and customer approval cycles.

children.text: Modern FAI processes leverage digital tools and automation to improve accuracy, reduce cycle time, and enhance traceability. Integration with manufacturing systems creates seamless quality workflows.

content.title: Aerospace First Article Inspection Requirement
content.scope: Defines requirements for first article inspection in aerospace manufacturing, including documentation formats, acceptance criteria, and approval processes.
keyRequirements: Complete dimensional verification of all characteristics
Traceability to drawing requirements and specifications
content.iisCompliance: IIS maintains full AS9102C compliance with certified quality engineers, calibrated measurement systems, and integrated digital documentation processes.

children.text: While AS9102 provides the foundation, many aerospace customers have additional requirements or variations that must be incorporated into your FAI process.

content.title: Common Customer FAI Variations
content.description: Typical customer-specific requirements beyond standard AS9102

seo.metaTitle: First Article Inspection (FAI) Guide | AS9102 Compliance | Aerospace
seo.metaDescription: Complete guide to First Article Inspection (FAI) per AS9102 standard. Master aerospace manufacturing compliance, documentation, and approval processes for quality control.
